name: ITP - Clearing and Grubbing, Earthworks - Cut, Fill and Subgrade Preparation
Template Name: ITP - Clearing and Grubbing, Earthworks - Cut, Fill and Subgrade Preparation Rev0

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC drawings and drawing registers
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review / Visual inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: OHSMP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP. Access and egress inspected and assessed for stability.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: OHSMP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A ground penetration permit must be issued prior to excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment must be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.4 Implementation of environmental measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: EMP meets the requirements of the specification and all controls have been implemented as per approved EMP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec Cl176.A3, EMP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ Vegetation to be removed clearly marked and agreed. All removal consistent with contract drawings and permits. Shall fence and sign all sites nominated as No-Go Zones.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to comencement of any work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to the commencement of any work, the Contractor and the Superintendent shall conduct a joint inspection of the site to identify vegetation to be retained and protected.

○ If directed by the Superintendent, existing trees, shrubs, native grasses and groundcovers and other areas of existing vegetation shall be protected by temporary fencing and incorporated into the works by the Contractor.
○ Protective fencing shall consist of, as a minimum, star pickets with three strands of wire and parawebbing.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to removal of vegetation
○ Nominated sites of archaelogical and / or heritage significance inspected on-site and clearly identified and protected as No-Go zones
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check that all relevant approvals have been granted including verification of the works area
○ Ensure work pack is reviewed & signed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: DBYD - locate and mark all existing services and confirm clearance from proposed work
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DBYD Records, Plan Mark-Ups
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Consider the requirements for traffic management, ensuring all works comply with required TMS, TMP and TGS.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Limits of clearing and grubbing shall be the whole length between the following chainages:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.2 Clear and grub trees and vegetation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The area within the specified limits shall be cleared of all vegetation, refuse and obstructions down to natural surface. The Contractor shall not undertake any clearing work or any type of disturbance outside of the specified limits of work unless approved by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.3 Clear and grub trees and vegetation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation is to occur: all vegetation, refuse and obstructions totally grubbed or grubbed > 0.3m below subgrade and batters (whichever is the lesser treatment)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.4 Clear and grub trees and vegetation (embankment areas)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas to be covered by embankments < 1.0m in height: all vegetation, refuse and obstructions grubbed > 0.3m below stripped surface OR > 0.6m below subgrade level (whichever is the lesser treatment)
○ In areas to be covered by embankments > 1.0m in height: foundations may remian if located or cut off not more than 0.4m above natural surface but not less than 1.0m below subgrade
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.5 Clear and grub trees and vegetation at culvert sites
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clear and grub trees and stumps within 10m of any proposed bridge or culvert having a waterway area > 6 m2 (unless otherwise shown on drawings)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any holes produced from grubbing operations have been backfilled with similar material and compacted to the same degree as the surrounding material
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tree trunks and large branches shall be removed from site. Small tree branches, weeds and shrubs shall be disposed of by chipping and mulching.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Immediately repair any damage to fences to a condition at least equal to that before damage
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the contractor and Superintendent shall inspect and agree upon the type / category of material encountered
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Topsoil stripped to full width of the formation and placed in approved stockpile location. Stockpile shaped to shed water and stripped surfaces graded to be self draining. Topsoil shall not be removed from site unless approved by the superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Each Lot containing unsuitable material
○ For unsuitable material, the proposed in-situ treatment or extent of excavation submitted to the Superintendent for review.
○ Material classified as silt, either before or after compaction, is not acceptable as Type A material without stablisation to the satisfaction of the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Fill material free of topsoil, deleterious and/or perishable matter.
○ Type A material shall comply with the requirements of Table 204.041

○ Type B material shall have minimum Assigned CBR of 4% and Assigned swell less than 2.5%. Materials with swell greater than 2.5% can only be used as Type B material if approved by the superintendent.
○ Type C material shall be capable of being spread in layers of not more than 500mm
FREQUENCY: Each Lot (prior to construction of regulating layer)
○ Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ Any necessary amendments to the subsurface drainage design including transverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be presented to Superintendent for review.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ Where groundwater is encountered the contractor shall notify the superintendent and submit proposed action for review.
○ The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Water Authorities and Superintendent Approval, This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface of cut and fill batters to be topsoiled and textured by scarifying or horizontal grooving
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ Borrow Excavations within the road reservation are not permitted without prior approval of Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Correspondance with superintendent
3.9 Areas upon which fills are to be constructed
○ Areas where fill is to be constructed must be reviewed by the superintendent prior to the placement of any fill in the area
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Fill placed and spread in uniform layers. Each layer keyed into the next with a textured surface. Any rocky material uniformly distributed throughout the layer.
○ Compacted layers do not exceed specified maximum thicknesses:
○ Type A: Maximum compacted thickness 200mm (can be used in locations specified for Type B material)

○ Type B: Maximum compacted thickness 200mm (can be used in locations specified for Type C material). Where > 25% rock by volume, loose layer thickness may equal 125% of typical maximum particle dimension up to max 500mm. No rocks > 80% of loose thickness of the layer.
○ Type C: Maximum compacted thickness 300mm. Where > 25% rock by volume, loose thickness of each layer may equal the maximum particle dimension of the rock up to max 500mm. Reference table 204.111
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

○ Areas upon which fills are to be constructed, all layers of fill, material within 150 mm of the cut floor level in cuts, and all stabilisied material shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: In accordance with Table 204.031. Lots < 4,000m²
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formation width and alignment: not less than the widths specified or shown on the drawings
○ Formation level and shape: Verges match FSL at outer edge of shoulder or pavement (± 50mm from design level)
○ Boxing width and alignment: not less than specified or design levels & no deviation > 50mm from designed offset from the centreline or design line.
○ Type A Material: thickness and width not less than specified at any point.
○ Type B material (immediately below capping / selected material): +15mm -30mm specified level
○ Cut floor level (when capping layer required): +15mm -30mm specified level
○ Cut floor level (no capping layer): same as subgrade tolerance
○ Subgrade Scale A & B: random levelling Cl204.03(h). No point > 20mm below a 3m straightedge laid in any direction.
○ Batter and slope: Not steeper than specified at any cross section.
○ Batter line: Batter point < 10% of the batter height outside the calculated batter line.
○ Surface Drains: Invert levels and side slopes ±50mm and free from depressions capable of retaining water.

○ The contractor shall establish a procedure to verify that compacted layers do not exceed the specified thickness. Verification records must provide evidence of measurements taken every three layers.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Survey report
4.4 Fill Material Compaction & Moisture Content Requirements
FREQUENCY: Each Lot as defined in Table 204.142.
○ Small area lots (<500m2) as per Cl173.04d.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Reference Documents for particular Tolerances, Properties and Testing Scales and subsequent Requirements.
○ Table 204.161 for Project Specific Scales for each applicable Road Name or Area.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Once per lot or per material change, as per Table 204.141
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Reference Documents for particular Frequency of Testing and Material Properties Testing Requirements.
○ Table 204.161 for Project Specific Scales for each applicable Road Name or Area.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
4.6 Preparation and Maintenance of Final Earthwork Surface and Subgrade
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Smooth, hard, tightly bound surface presented. Free from depressions capable of holding water.
○ Material within 150mm of subgrade shall be maintained such that its moisture content is not less than 70% of OMC prior to placement of pavement layer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
Table 204.031 Minimum Number of Level Measurements and Tolerances
Scale of Surface Level Measurement || Minimum Number of Measurements per Lot || Tolerance: x̅ Range (mm) || Tolerance: Maximum S (mm)
1. x̅ is the mean value of all level readings taken in the lot
2. S is the standard deviation of all level readings taken in the lot
3. A negative value designates a measured departure below the design level and positive value designates a surface level above the design level
Location and Use of Type A Material || Physical Properties: Assigned CBR (min) % (1) || Physical Properties: Swell % (1) || Physical Properties: Permeability (max) m/s (2)
Other Type A Material || ##:6 || ≤ 1.5 || Not Applicable
Location and Use of Type A Material || Limits of Grading (% passing by mass) :: Post Compaction Sieve Size AS (mm)
(1) The Assigned CBR and percentage swell values are to be determined in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice RC 500.20. Sampling for CBR testing shall be undertaken after field compaction.

(2) The permeability value is to be determined in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice RC 500.16. The permeability value is to be determined on specimens manufactured from that fraction of material which passes a 19.0 mm AS sieve, compacted at optimum moisture content and 98% of maximum dry density as determined by testing using standard compactive effort for CBR and swell.

Non Vibrating Rollers - Static Weight * (tonne) || Vibrating Rollers - Total Applied Force ** (kN) || Minimum Distance from Compaction Plant to Abutments, Retaining Walls and Wing Walls (m) || Minimum Cover over Top of Culverts (m)
21 - 35 || 201 - 350 || 2.4 or height of structure (whichever is greater) || 1.2 or height or structure (whichever is greater) || 0.7
* Includes vibrating rollers operating in non-vibrating mode.
** Total Applied Force is the sum of the static weight and the vertical component of centrifugal force.

Material Type and Location || Scale A: Minimum Characteristic Value of Density Ratio (%) || Scale B: Minimum Characteristic Value of Density Ratio (%) || Scale C: Minimum Characteristic Value of Density Ratio (%)
Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material || 99.0 || 98.0 || 100.0
Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level || 99.0 || 98.0 || 100.0
Type B Material placed more than 400 mm below top of Type B Material || 97.0 || 95.0 || 95.0
The top 150 mm of areas where fill is to be constructed || 97.0 || 95.0 || 95.0
Table 204.142 Minimum Frequency of Testing for Compaction and Moisture Content
Material || Acceptable Lot Size in a Single Layer of Work || Minimum Testing Frequency
Type A Material || One day's production or 5,000 m^2, whichever is the lesser || Every second lot of like material and work
• Ripped and re-compacted below Cut Floor Level || One day's production or 10,000 m^2, whichever is the lesser || Every sercond lot of like material and work
• Placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material || One day's production or 10,000 m^2, whichever is the lesser || Every second lot of like material and work
• Placed more than 400 mm below top of Type B Material || One day's production || Every third lot of like material and work
Type C Material || One day's production || Every sixth lot of like material and work
Table 204.161 Schedule for Surface Tolerance, Material Properties and Compaction Testing
Road Name || Chainage / Location || Scale of Surface Level Measurement (A, B or C) || Scale of Material Property Testing (A or B) || Scale of Compaction (A, B or C)
Bruny Island Main Road || Within Limits of Works || B || B || B
Note: Where no level of testing is nominated, Scale A applies.
ITP - Stormwater and Subsurface Drainage
Template Name: ITP - Stormwater and Subsurface Drainage Rev1

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
– Conflicting documents will be referenced to the hierarchy of documents listed in Section 175.03
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers, Cl 175.03
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: OHSMP, EMP, TMS, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes supplied shall be of the category and diameter shown on the drawings or specified in clause 702.12 and shall comply with the requirements of the appropriate Australian Standard in accordance with Section 175 or as follows:
○ Granular material as per clause 702.05, Geotextile material as per clause 702.06
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Order acceptance certificate, This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipe class and size and endwall type as per drawings and Cl 701.05
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Order acceptance certificate
2.2 Precast Reinforced Concrete Inlet and Outlet Structures supply
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The supply of precast inlet and outlet structures shall conform with D.S.G standard drawings
○ Concrete supply shall conform with Section 610 and reinforcement supply shall comply with Section 611.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Recievable Inspection Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding and Backfill materials free from perishable matter and lumps and shall conform with the requirements of Table 701.091 and Table 701.092
○ Ordinary backfill shall be free from perishable matter and shall conform with the requirements of Table 701.091
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Quarry test report
Prior to commencement of excavation for the culverts the contractor shall confirm the position of all culverts with the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey records, pegs on ground & this ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation for the installation of pipes shall allow for the clearance from the outside of the pipe to the wall of the trench between 300mm and 600mm;

○ The base of the trench shall be inspected to verify compliance with the requirements in this clause prior to placing bedding in comleted exacavations.The Superintendent shall be notified at least 24 hours prior to the inspection.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding material placed in full width of trench and compacted to at least 100mm thick, or; where the culvert is to be placed without trenching, to a width of 0.8m greater than the overall width of the culvert.
○ Bedding of granular filter material of thickness between 25 mm and 50mm shall be placed across bottom of trench and shall be tamped and screeded or graded to level.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Laying of pipes to commence from the downstream end. Pipes to be laid with rebate or socket end facing upstream and be fully entered. Departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10 mm in 10 m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250.
○ Pipes shall be placed centrally in the trench on the prepared bedding and held firmly in place
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rubber ring joint pipes shall be jointed with rubber rings. Rubber rings shall be kept undisturbed, clean, and free from dirt and other foreign materials and shall be stored undercover if pipes are not to be installed immediately.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Location of each culvert run verified by survey prior to backfilling and recorded in as-constructed drawings.
• Invert level of pipes at pits ± 50mm
• Departure from design grade of pipe runs ± 10mm in 10m provided min grade > 1:250
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (i) Culvert Under Area to be Paved
• The trench shall be backfilled to design subgrade level with selected material.
(ii) Culvert Under Area not to be Paved
• The trench shall be backfilled with selected backfill material to a level 0.3 m above the top of the culvert and with ordinary backfill material above that level.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
○ Filter material shall be moistened and compacted with minimal disturbance to pipes. The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the submitted quality procedures
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

○ Where no fines concrete is used as filter material the Contractor shall submit quality procedures for review by the Superintendent which detail the method of placing the no-fines concrete to prevent segregation and the formation of a slurry layer at the surface of the concrete which may prevent the passage of water into the filter material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
4.4 Testing and Acceptance of Fill Materials
FREQUENCY: 3 Tests per Lot tested with 20% of all Lots tested
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150mm loose thickness and shall be assessed for compaction and moisture content.
Bedding shall be compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
Backfill material with nominal size < 40mm after compaction shall be compacted to a mean density ratio of not less than 97% CDR.
Backfill material with a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Compaction Test Result OR This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Access point installed at the beginning and end of the drainage run and inspection openings at intervals between 100m and 150m. Flushout risers have same diameter as pipe.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Flushing test undertaken on each subsurface drainage line after completion of the drains, flushers and risers, and after completion of barriers and road furniture. The test should be witnessed by a representative nomitated by the superintendent. Record of flushing tests must be kept.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests
4.7 Installation of Inlet or Outlet Structure
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inlet and outlet structures shall be installed to a tolerance of +-20mm where matching kerbs or barriers or +-100mm in all other areas.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Until the minimum compacted thickness of cover in Table 701.141 for axle or track loading has been provided, construction traffic shall not be permitted to cross the culvert.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

○ Bottom of trench shall be compacted and at a depth no more than 50mm below the specified pipe invert. Grade of the base of the trench shall not allow ponding of water Any loose material shall be removed. To be inspected by Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding of granular filter material of thickness between 25 mm and 50mm placed across bottom of trench and screeded or graded to level
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes placed centrally in trench and held firmly in place positioned with openings at the lower half of the pipe.
○ If geofabric required (subsurface drains installed in expansive materials), minimum width of geotextile used for wrapping is 450 mm
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
○ Filter material shall be moistened and compacted with minimal disturbance to pipes. The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the procedures and reviewed by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Granular filter material placed and compacted compacted in layers not exceeding 300mm with minimal disturbance to pipes. Concrete is to be placed and compacted within one hour of mixing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installed in accordance with drawings and Cl 702.10
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Flushing test shall be witnessed by a representative nominated by the superintendent and shall confirm that the drainage line is free of obstruction. To be complete after installation of kerb and channel, barriers and road furniture.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All stormwater inlet and outlet connections shall be cut trimmed neat and finished with cementitious mortar.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

○ All subsurface drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of the flushing test and prior to placement of asphalt, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Damaged pipes shall be repaired in accordance with 701.31 of the Specification, no repairs shall be undertaken without the Superintendent's approval of the repair materials and procedures.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

○ All drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of earthworks to subgrade level and prior to construction of pavement layers, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ITP - Surfacing - Asphalt Placement & Spray Sealing
Template Name: ITP - Surfacing - Asphalt Placement & Spray Sealing Rev1

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All asphalt mixes proposed for use in the works shall have a mix design registered by the Victorian Department of Transport as 'General', unless otherwise approved by the Victorian Department of Transport.

○ The registration for all mixes incorporated into the works shall be current at the time of their use. The contractor shall submit documentation to the Superintendent nominating the asphalt mixes to be supplied no less than 7 days prior to their use.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix registration & correspondence
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The surface on which asphalt is to be placed shall be essentially dry and free from surface water. Asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface is wet, or rain is imminent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt shall not be placed when majority of the area to be paved has a surface temperature less than that detailed as follows:
○ Base or Intermediate Courses: 5°C for specified binder class of C170 or C320; or 10°C for asphalt mixes with specified binder class of C600 or containing a PMB.
○ Wearing Course: 10°C for specified binder class of C170 or C320; or 15°C for asphalt mixes with specified binder class of C600 or containing a PMB.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Satisfactory field performance. When adhesion agent is added to the binder, the total volume of adhesion agent ≤1% of the binder.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Aggregate Precoating Materials shall be distillate, distillate based product, cutback bitumen, emulsion based product or proprietary product.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bitumen shall be Class 170 complying with the requirements of AS 2008.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bitumen Emulsion shall comply with the requirements of AS 1160.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cutback bitumen shall comply with the requirements of AS 2157.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cutters shall comply with the properties in the Table 408.091.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The class of PMB shall comply with the requirements of Austroads Technical Specification ATS-3110. Alternative or 'ungraded' PMMBs which do not comply with the specified test requirements of ATS-3110 shall not be used without approval by the Superintendent and will be subject to the Contractor providing evidence that the product has delievered satisfactory fiels performance for a period of at least three years.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The primer shall be cutback bitumen complying with the requirements of clause 408.08(c) and shall be water resistant, of uniform appearance and capable of providing a strong bond between the bituminous surfacing and the pavement.Bitumen emulsion alternative acceptable upon providing evidence that the emulsion product meets the same functional requirements.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Aggregate shall comply with sections:
○ 801 - Source Rock for the Production of Crushed Rock and Aggregates
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Supply plant precoated aggregate or field precoated aggregate.
○ Aggregate precoating shall be undertaken using a purpose-built item of plant to apply to the precoating material in a controlled manner that produces a uniform coating.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All areas – within 8 hours of sealing as it is mfreeway and AADT is greater than 5000, as per table 408.141, unless otherwise agreed with the Superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Adhesive components shall be batched so that the mixed adhesive contains not less than 45% nor more than 55% by volume of either component. Before starting work each day, or when changing to a different batch of adhesive, a hand mixed colour standard shall be prepared for reference during the day.
○ When hand-mixing is used not more than 500 g of each component shall be mixed at any time.
○ The components shall be mixed on a flat surface and the mixed adhesive shall be used within 10 minutes of the time the two components are brought together.
○ Hot melt bitumen adhesive shall not be used on days of total fire ban without the written approval of the Tasmanian Fire Service
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

• when the ambient temperature or the temperature of the road surface is less than 15deg for standard set adhesive or 0deg for rapid set or hot melt adhesive.

○ Where a marker is not positioned correctly within 10 seconds for hot melt bitumen adhesive, 2 minutes for rapid set machine mix adhesive, 4 minutes for standard set machine mix, or 10 minutes for standard set hand mix from the time mixing commences, it shall be discarded and a new marker placed.

○ Longitudinal mismatch between markers in transverse pairs at barrier line not more than 25 mm.
○ Lower edge of the reflective face at 85deg to 95deg to the centreline of the roadway or any adjacent line.
